page.title: 11TRAFFIC SURVEY
page.content: A traffic count was conducted at the gates of St. Michael's school between 10.05am and 11.55am on Tuesday June 4th 1985 and again on Friday June 14th 1985 between 1.30pm and 3.20pm.The results in each period were comparable.Cars and commercial vehicles were the most frequent passers.Taking both periods together 607 commercial vehicles travelled towards Colne and 299 towards Skipton,whilst 2658 cars travelled towards Colne,and 1759 towards Skipton.By far the most frequently observed vehicles were those belonging to Pendle Council. Bus services are not very frequent and the private car is much relied upon.Bicycles are used but the undulating countryside militates against them.
